title: Man Utd news: Paul Ince slams David De Gea after reaction to defeat to Newcastle
text:
David De Gea was at a loss to explain Manchester United’s defeat against Newcastle (Picture: Getty)

Paul Ince has criticised David De Gea for failing to address Manchester United’s shortcomings after their 1-0 defeat to Newcastle United at St James’ Park on Sunday.

United slipped to their third Premier League loss of the season after De Gea was beaten by a low drive from 19-year-old debutant Matty Longstaff with 18 minutes remaining.

After the match, De Gea was asked where United need to improve, to which he responded: ‘Everything. A lot of things [need] to improve. I don’t know what to say.’

Matty Longstaff’s goal handed Newcastle United a 1-0 win against Manchester United on Sunday (Picture: Getty)

Those comments have not gone down well with former United midfielder Ince who believes that the club’s supporters have a right to be furious at De Gea over his comments.

‘I watched David de Gea’s post-match interview and I was at a loss,’ Ince told Paddy Power. ‘He’s meant to be one of the leaders, if that was Peter Schmeichel standing there, there’s no chance you’d have seen that interview.

‘Rather than him addressing and recognising where the team were going wrong, it just felt like ‘I don’t know, I don’t know, I don’t know.’

‘This is one of the top players, the leaders at Man United, who has just signed a five-year contract! And he looks like he doesn’t have a clue what’s going on.

‘If you’re a United fan listening to your goalkeeper, one of the main leaders in the team, and that’s the interview you here you’d be right to be disgraced.’

Despite United’s current problems, De Gea committed his long-term future to the club last month, signing a new four-year contract worth a reported £350,000 per week.

Since De Gea pen to paper on a contract extension, United have won just once in six matches in all competitions and Ince believes the Spanish international will regret signing the deal.

‘I’d be looking thinking, Jesus, he doesn’t have a clue what’s going on – I bet he’s regretting signing that contract,’ he said.
